cc'ing Stefan to comment on the occurrences of:
RuntimeException: Widget disposed too early!
in the log.

java.lang.RuntimeException: Widget disposed too early!
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ShellPool$1.widgetDisposed(ShellPool.java:50)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:844)

Widget disposed to early indicates that a part's widget was disposed without
calling WorkbenchPartReference.dispose(). This usually indicates that a part was
leaked, but it can also be caused by someone reaching in and directly destroying
the part's controls. The most common cause of a leak is another exception
occuring in the middle of the cleanup code, in which case there will be another
exception in the log (the real problem) next to a set of "too early" exceptions.
In this case, the leaked view was detached at the time of shutdown.

Hope that is helpful.
Reducing severity.  The problem is intermittent and only happens on Window 2003 Server.
